intro: Trichotosia ochracea, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Trichotosia ochracea is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a short-lived perennial.
